txt.en: 'Endless thanks, [placeholder]. If you had not been here...well, there is little point in walking that sad road.\n\n'You have saved the Elves of my company, friend Warden, and I thank you for it.'
'That is a relief, Andyri!'
'I am ready to leave this place, [placeholder]. We were victorious this day, thanks to your able defence, but it was almost not so. You have my thanks and the thanks of my friends for it.'
Instance: A Defence in the Darkness
'At last!'
An Elf has fallen in battle. You have failed as a Warden.
'This way, [placeholder]!'
Andyri is waiting to speak with you inside the Stone-troll caves.
'Friends, I have returned with [placeholder]!'
You must prevent the Elves from being defeated while they rest from their battles.
Andyri is in the Stone-troll cave.\n\nYou have protected Andyri's Elves while they recovered and should now speak with her.
'[placeholder]! The Stone-trolls are returning!'
Follow Andyri
'We slew many, but we are winded from the struggle and many Duvárdain remain.'
Talk to Andyri
'We need time to rest. We are weakened and will fight only if we must.'
Defend the Elves until they have recovered their strength
'Keep the fighting from us until we are rested, Warden!'
Talk to Andyri
Do not allow any of the Elves to die
'I am ready for battle!'
'To battle!'
You have come to the Stone-troll caves near Lin Giliath to defend Andyri's Elves while they recover from their pitched battle.
'We have done it, [placeholder]! Your skill as a Warden has made the difference!'
'Were you able to defeat the Duvárdain presence in these caves?'
'And it is almost daybreak; the Stone-trolls will soon return to their caves.'
'[placeholder], you must protect us until these Elves are rested and ready to fight!'
'At last, [placeholder]! We must hurry to the Elves of my company, for they are weak from their battle and will not long be able to defend themselves.'
